meanings.sent1: The family heirloom was very preciouses to her.
meanings.sent2: She kept the preciouses necklace in a safe place.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's teddy bear was so preciouses, she even gave it a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as preciouses as a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day were more preciouses than gold.

meanings.definition: Used as a term of endearment
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed, 'Preciouses!' through the room.
meanings.sent5: Preciouses, you light up my day!

meanings.definition: To treat with affection or care
meanings.sent1: She preciouses her little sister by reading her bedtime stories.
meanings.sent2: He preciouses his garden by watering it every day.
meanings.sent3: The cat preciouses its favorite toy by carrying it everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preciouses each student's unique talents.
meanings.sent5: They preciouses the old photo album full of memories.
